title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 10 January 2014 - XWiki
content:

08:23 <tmortagne> has quit  
08:24 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:45 <ClemensR> duh, I cannot remove some extra lines I  added by accident, sorry :-/  
08:47 <tmortagne> ClemensR: I think those are the canonical form, you used the WYSIWYG ?  
08:47 <ClemensR> no, the wiki-syntax section editor  
08:48 <ClemensR> i.e. not editing the full page, just edited the paragraph  
08:49 <tmortagne> yes the result is pretty much the same: the result is a parsed and then rendered result (in this case it parse the section and insert it in the XDOM before rendering the whole content again)  
08:50 <tmortagne> anyway it's ok since it's the same thing  
08:50 <ClemensR> ah, ok, phew  
08:51 <tmortagne> (you could "fix" it by editing the whole page in wiki mode)  
09:03 <vmassol> good morning  
09:03 <vmassol> WDYT about releasing a 5.4M2 on next Monday (13th) and keep the RC1 for the 20th?  
09:04 <vmassol> too much overhead? I'm just a bit worried that we're introducing a lot of stuff in a RC version. Or we could rename RC1 as M2 altogether and skip a RC release  
09:05 <vmassol> other questin: Roman modified the home page for admin guide at http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/viewrev/AdminGuide/WebHome?rev=17.1 Do you prefer his version to our previous one: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/viewrev/AdminGuide/WebHome?rev=17.1 ? Personally I prefer the previous one using DL/DT  
09:06 <vmassol> (also it's now inconsistent in L&F with other guide's home pages)  
09:06 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:08 <tmortagne> vmassol: yes it's inconsistent and I don't see much improvement in the new one  
09:11 <tmortagne> as for the releases I'm fine with keeping the RC1 on my side (i.e. not introduce a M2)  
09:12 <UCC> has joined #xwiki  
09:15 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:15 <cjd> has joined #xwiki

09:32 <andreeapopescu> has joined #xwiki  
09:37 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <DarkKnightCZ> hi, how to get wiki owner from velocity? xcontext.getXWiki().getWikiOwner has servername param (and it's undocumented)  
10:36 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:46 <Kaisen> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <Kaisen> Hello, I wish you all a good new year.  
10:47 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: not sure what servername you are talking about, probably a quite old javadoc. http://maven.xwiki.org/site/docs/xwiki-javadoc-5.0.x/com/xpn/xwiki/XWiki.html#getWikiOwner%28java.lang.String,%20com.xpn.xwiki.XWikiContext%29 seems pretty clear  
10:48 <Kaisen> has quit  
10:48 <Kaisen> has joined #xwiki  
10:48 <Kaisen> I have just a short question. If i want to link in a page to a Headline, is there a easy way or did I need to link to the page itself and got to the wiki editor and add manuall the || anchor parameter?  
10:49 <Kaisen> has quit  
10:50 <Kaisen> has joined #xwiki  
10:51 <Kaisen> has quit  
10:53 <Kaisen> has joined #xwiki  
10:53 <ClemensR> Kaisen: second one, as far as I know  
10:53 <Kaisen> So link it to the page and set an anchor manually  
10:53 <Kaisen> ok  
10:54 <ClemensR> if you give the link a tooltip in the WYSIWYG editor, you at least save yourself the problem of typing the '||' , but that is all  
10:54 <Kaisen> has quit  
10:55 <Kaisen> has joined #xwiki  
10:56 <Kaisen> has quit  
10:56 <Kaisen> has joined #xwiki  
10:56 <Kaisen> has quit  
11:06 <Kaisen> has joined #xwiki  
11:06 <Kaisen> Sorry, I had some trouble wiht my IRC client  
11:06 <Kaisen> What did you mean with enter the Infromation in the Tooltip?  
11:07 <Kaisen> I tought it is just a tool tip to enter information about the linke etc.  
11:12 <ClemensR> yes, and it is just that this shows at [link||title="foo"], so you do not have to type the '||'  but still have to type the 'anchor=...'  
11:13 <ClemensR> I did not mean that this is really some help ... it is just that this is supported  
11:15 <ClemensR> I remember I have written an edit panel where you an paste in the headline and get back the anchor you want, but that was back in XWIKI 2.x and the current translation is a bit different  
11:15 <mflorea> has quit  
11:16 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
11:16 <lucaa> has quit  
11:30 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:32 <andreeapopescu> has quit  
11:33 <andreeapopescu> has joined #xwiki  
11:33 <Kaisen> Ok ClemensR than I need to go this way  
11:34 <ClemensR> I guess one can extract information about all the headlines in a document, but the UI currently does not do that  
11:35 <ClemensR> especially as an "anchor" link is not really a reference you can track (i.e. it gets broken as soon as you rename the headline)  
11:39 <Kaisen> Yes, it is just if you have a big page and want to jump from one headline to the other it help the people instead of scrolling all the time  
11:39 <Kaisen> As the Index is not moving with you have to manually link them from lower headlines  
11:41 <zenzla2> has joined #xwiki  
11:41 <zenzla> has quit  
11:43 <vmassol> ClemensR: the issue needs to be closed with invalid  
11:43 <vmassol> doing it  
11:43 <vmassol> or cannot reproduce  
11:43 <ClemensR> ah, ok, I thought "Done" was ok  
11:44 <vmassol> done means something was done  
11:44 <vmassol> (ie at least one commit)  
11:44 <vmassol> the goal  
11:44 <vmassol> is to not show the issue in the release notes  
11:44 <vmassol> since it doesn't correspond to a real issue  
11:45 <ClemensR> ah, ok, I see. I thought not giving it a "Fix Version" does that.  
11:45 <vmassol> I'm still surprised it works across the board but good if it does :)  
11:46 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: yep, old javadoc, thanks  
11:49 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
11:50 <fmancinelli> Hi all, we are playing with subwikis and we have something we don't understand... We have a xwiki:XWiki.Admin global user which belongs to xwiki:XWiki.AdminGroup. In the subwiki we don't have any local XWiki.Admin user.  
11:51 <fmancinelli> now what we don't understand is that in the subwiki the following call return false $xwiki.user.isUserInGroup("xwiki:XWiki.AdminGroup") while being xwiki:XWiki.Admin  
11:51 <fmancinelli> while we expected it to return true  
11:52 <fmancinelli> any idea?  
11:53 <tmortagne> fmancinelli: I guess it means XWikiUser does not take into account the wiki and just look in current wiki  
11:54 <ClemensR> or the user making the call cannot access the xwiki:XWiki.AdminGroup (maybe?)  
11:54 <woshilapin> That's what we guess too...  
11:54 <fmancinelli> tmortagne: yep, that's what we thought - is it a bug or a feature? :)  
11:55 <tmortagne> definitely a bug  
11:55 <tmortagne> now XWikiUser is not really used in XE, we use rightsmanager plugin instead  
11:55 <fmancinelli> ah  
11:55 <fmancinelli> so maybe we are doing it using a deprecated way  
11:56 <tmortagne> lets say rightsmanager and the most recent way  
11:57 <tmortagne> but it's still not a perfect user/group manager API  
11:57 <tmortagne> anyway isUserInGroup is not tagged as deprecated and has a bug so it deserve a jira issue IMO  
11:58 <fmancinelli> ok I will create an issue  
12:03 <tmortagne> has quit  
12:04 <andreeapopescu> has quit  
12:16 <zenzla> has joined #xwiki  
12:18 <zenzla2> has quit  
12:30 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:42 <vmassol> guys, fyi, I'm on holidays this afternoon (sorry to not have mentioned this earlier). I'll be connected around end of afternoon though  
12:55 <sburjan`> vmassol: could you give your opinion on the mail I've sent on devslist about XWiki + Activiti ? About naming the jira project  
12:55 <vmassol> sburjan`: you pick the name you wish  
12:56 <sburjan`> vmassol: I know, just wanted your opinion :)  
12:56 <vmassol> but  
12:57 <vmassol> AFAICS it's more an application  
12:57 <vmassol> because it choses to use activitii in a certain directed way and a subset of it  
12:57 <sburjan`> I was confused because CRaAS has also some UI, but you called it Integration. This is why I am a little bit confused  
12:58 <sburjan`> okay, I am going to reply to the thread and the wait for someone to create the repo and the project  
12:58 <vmassol> I can create the repo now  
12:58 <vmassol> application-activiti is ok?  
12:59 <sburjan`> vmassol: yes  
12:59 <sburjan`> also replied on the thread  
13:01 <vmassol> done  
13:01 <vmassol> https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-activiti  
13:01 <sburjan`> thanks vmassol ! :)  
13:15 <sburjan`> vmassol: I think there is something wrong with 5.2.3. When I create a subwiki the DW asks me if this is an upgrade. This wasn't happening on 5.2.2  
13:15 <polx> has quit  
13:17 <woshilapin> has quit  
13:17 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
13:20 <vmassol> sburjan`: no  
13:20 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
13:20 <vmassol> GD doesn't work on Fridays  
13:20 <fmancinelli> has quit  
13:20 <sburjan`> and also it seems there are other issues about the Admin user not being seen as member of a subwiki he created  
13:20 <sburjan`> :( than I'll have to wait for him on Monday  
13:21 <vmassol> you could send an email  
13:21 <vmassol> no don't wait  
13:21 <mflorea> has quit  
13:21 <vmassol> send an email  
13:21 <vmassol> on the list  
13:21 <sburjan`> vmassol: Ok, I will send an e-mail on devlist  
13:21 <vmassol> thanks  
13:21 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:22 <evalica2> has joined #xwiki  
13:23 <evalica> has quit  
13:25 <evalica1> has quit  
13:26 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
13:27 <evalica2> has quit  
13:27 <ClemensR> sburjan` :  might be a known issue  
13:29 <ClemensR> maybe similar to XWIKI-9862  
13:33 <sburjan`> ClemensR: yes, but from my knowledge the 5.2 branch doesn't have the tons of changes as the 5.3 and 5.4 branches do. 5.2.3 is a stabilization version, so it doesn't contain the big changes from newer versions  
13:36 <ClemensR> me bad, it is a dupe of XWIKI-9847  ... maybe it is still the same problem (is there a check for a hardwired number of pages in yet?)  
13:37 <ClemensR> "Admin user not being seen as member of a subwiki" is something different however  
13:37 <ClemensR> fmancinelli complained bout something similar in the morning  
13:38 <ClemensR> ah, no, that is XWIKI-9871 and something different  
13:41 <andreeapopescu> has joined #xwiki  
13:42 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
13:55 <vmassol> has quit  
14:00 <andreeapopescu> has quit  
14:27 <Denis> has quit  
14:43 <DarkKnightCZ> after upgrading xwiki from 5.1 to 5.3, there are multiple errors with non-existent wikis (workspaces), these wikis were deleted (on 5.1), any idea how to permanently delete these? (e.g. where in database are subwikis stored)  
14:45 <ClemensR> are the subwikis still shown in the "wiki index"? or what is the problem?  
14:49 <DarkKnightCZ> ClemensR: yep, they are show, trying to delete them  
14:49 <DarkKnightCZ> ok, so small problem... these wikis are missing delete button :)  
14:51 <ClemensR> do you see an "Edit" actuon for them, then ?  
14:52 <zenzla2> has joined #xwiki  
14:52 <DarkKnightCZ> nope :)  
14:53 <zenzla> has quit  
14:53 <ClemensR> ah, ok .... but I guess the XWiki.XWikiServerFoo pages are still there  
14:53 <ClemensR> to find them, make sure the "show hidden docs" is "yes" in your user profile, and then go to the document index  
14:54 <DarkKnightCZ> yep, they exist  
14:54 <ClemensR> Type in "XWiki" for the space ans "XWikiServer" for the document .... and wait till the search show the results. I guess you can just deleted these pages then  
14:55 <ClemensR> Only the pages where the wiki / workspace has been deleted, of course ;)  
14:56 <ClemensR> I just see the  "last author" for my subwikis "XWikiServerSubwiki" pages is XWiki.WebHome aka the unknown user, btw :)  
14:57 <DarkKnightCZ> yes, unknown user :)  
14:58 <ClemensR> I have no idea what happens when one deletes these pages when the subwiki still exists ...  
14:58 <mflorea> has quit  
14:58 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
15:02 <DarkKnightCZ> yep :) well no errors now, thanks  
15:05 <ClemensR> ok, I hope there are still some subwikis ;)  glad to hear it worked :)  
15:07 <DarkKnightCZ> well i deleted only pages for that deleted subwikis, so everything works as before :) oh, and congrats for commiter rank  
15:08 <ClemensR> thanks :)  
15:25 <DarkKnightCZ> just one question, where can i find solr schema? (according to http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/IRC/xwikiArchive20131203;jsessionid=A16EED5A6E11FF53CE3E46C632265188 , multiple values problem)  
15:28 <ClemensR> you can just move away the complete "solr" directory in your perm dir  
15:29 <ClemensR> solr will be a bit disappointed first but then rebuild the complete index  
15:29 <DarkKnightCZ> ok, thanks  
15:29 <ClemensR> (well, after a server restart)  
15:29 <DarkKnightCZ> (shutdown)  
15:34 <DarkKnightCZ> yep, solr doesn't complain now  
15:35 <ClemensR> ok, and box is a bit busy because of the complete reindex, maybe  
15:35 <DarkKnightCZ> yep

17:21 <cjd> is now known as <Guest31462>  
17:30 <tmortagne> sburjan`: did you tried the used case described in the mailing list "Wiki application templates error" ?  
17:30 <tmortagne> i.e. create a template and then create a wiki from this template  
17:30 <tmortagne> I don't see anything wrong in what he is doing and looks like the template is not copied, that would be a major bug  
17:31 <tmortagne> so I'm wondering if you tested it on 5.3 already  
17:31 <tmortagne> see if it's only him or a real general issue  
17:34 <DarkKnightCZ> hmm, bug or not? "XWiki Platform - User - UI", installed version 5.3, available version 5.0.3, XWiki 5.3  
17:35 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: not sure I understand exactly what you mean  
17:37 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
17:37 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: http://img2.stooorage.com/images/2540/10676952\_wiki.png  
17:40 <DarkKnightCZ> hmm, i guess bad choice of image storage web :) sorry for those ads, if you don't use adblock  
17:41 <DarkKnightCZ> http://img24.eu/images/4tlfdsw.png  should be ok  
17:44 <tmortagne> the result you get does not make much sense, even for the fist two (they obviously don't seems to be needed)  
17:46 <DarkKnightCZ> ok then  
17:46 <tmortagne> the extension updater should not propose them to you as far as I understand  
17:46 <tmortagne> are you in the main wiki or a subwiki ?  
17:46 <DarkKnightCZ> subwiki  
17:47 <tmortagne> what version of XWiki is it ?  
17:47 <DarkKnightCZ> 5.3 stable  
17:47 <tmortagne> you upgraded from 5.1 ?  
17:47 <DarkKnightCZ> yes  
17:48 <tmortagne> you fully upgraded the wiki ? because from what I see it does not seems to be the case since solr search seems to be in version 5.1  
17:48 <tmortagne> maybe the issue is that your UI is still in 5.1  
17:49 <DarkKnightCZ> yes, full upgrade, but there seems to be some errors (initial window showed several times, couldnt update some extensions), so i tried this manually (but everything else seems to work)  
17:49 <tmortagne> your wiki seems to be in a weird state  
17:49 <tmortagne> you have solr in 5.1, message stream in 5.0  
17:50 <tmortagne> both are standard XE dependencies  
17:50 <DarkKnightCZ> well, the list of extensions is larger  
17:50 <tmortagne> I don't know why you don't have the upgrade button for them  
17:51 <tmortagne> seems according to the UI it found 5.3 and you have 5.1 for example for solr  
17:51 <tmortagne> maybe the EM UI itself is not up to date and is incompatible with 5.3 backend  
17:53 <tmortagne> you should probably try to import Extension Manager UI by hand (with standard importer)  
17:53 <mflorea> has quit  
17:53 <tmortagne> http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-extension-ui/5.3/  
17:54 <DarkKnightCZ> hmm, it seems i have two versions of EM UI installed, 5.1 and 5.3  
17:54 <tmortagne> on that wiki ? or when you look in main wiki ?  
17:55 <tmortagne> (main wiki give information for all wikis)  
17:55 <DarkKnightCZ> on that wiki, on main it shows only 5.3  
17:56 <tmortagne> when you say you "so i tried this manually" what did you do exactly ?  
17:57 <DarkKnightCZ> just clicked on "Extension Updater" :)  
17:58 <DarkKnightCZ> but it's possible something broke during update... i will try it later again (this is testing instance)  
17:58 <tmortagne> the best is probably to retry the upgrade from scratch and report the exact issues you have especially the "couldnt update some extensions"  
17:59 <tmortagne> because I don't have much idea of how you can end up with two version of the same extension installed on the same wiki  
17:59 <DarkKnightCZ> yep... but everything else seems to work  
18:00 <tmortagne> yep it's possible you have the right page or at least pages that works will 5.3 backend but looks like your extensions index is not in a good state  
18:00 <tmortagne> you might want to check if installed extensions seems correct before the upgrade itself  
18:01 <tmortagne> maybe you already had issues before the upgrade which lost it  
18:01 <DarkKnightCZ> it's possible
